banterDialogues.professorPause: I'll give you folks a moment to think. Then I'll ask for your reactions.

studentBanter.speaker: Blake
studentBanter.text: Why can't we just start now?

studentBanter.speaker: Avery
studentBanter.text: Some of us need time to think. Not everybody shoots their mouth off instantly--Blake!

studentBanter.speaker: Blake
studentBanter.text: Yeah, Avery, you're probably going to tell us how everything in this seminar fits together, and your genius brain has it all figured out.

banterDialogues.professorPause: Remember. Don't react right away. Give it some thought.

studentBanter.speaker: Blake
studentBanter.text: Why don't you ever give your reaction first?

studentBanter.speaker: Casey
studentBanter.text: This is traditional pedagogical practice. It goes all the way back to Socrates. The ancient Greeks--

studentBanter.speaker: Drew
studentBanter.text: Oh, for heaven's sake, Casey. Get over yourself. We know you love the ancient Greeks. You love everything, as long as it's ancient and esoteric.

banterDialogues.professorReturnPre: OK, let's simmer down. Focus on what

banterDialogues.professorPause: OK, take a minute to think about that. How would you respond?

studentBanter.speaker: Avery
studentBanter.text: Hartwell's thinking before he says anything. Unlike some people.

studentBanter.speaker: Blake
studentBanter.text: What's the point of a seminar if we're just going to sit here in silence? I like to think out loud.

studentBanter.speaker: Drew
studentBanter.text: No one's stopping you from thinking any way you want. But let's let Professor Hartwell conduct the seminar.
